questions.question: What event caused the United States to enter World War II?

choices.answer: Germany bombed Great Britain.
Japan bombed Pearl Harbor.
Germany took over much of Western Europe.
Japan took over much of China and Southeast Asia.

questions.question: Why did Great Britain and France declare war on Germany?

choices.answer: Germany invaded Poland.
Germany invaded Austria and Czechoslovakia.
Germany formed an alliance with Italy and Japan.
Adolf Hitler became the dictator of Germany.

questions.question: Which of the following describes an effect of World War II on the United States economy?

choices.answer: Automobile companies produced a record number of cars.
Many factories had to expand to produce military equipment.
Airplane industry suffered
Cities with shipyards declined

questions.question: Why did the rise of dictators cause concern in the 1930s?

choices.answer: Countries ruled by dictators became weak.
Dictators placed high tariffs on imported goods.
Dictators believed in a weak central government.
Dictators often planned to attack & conquer other countries.

questions.question: Operation Torch was beneficial for the allied forces for the following reasons:

choices.answer: Forced many Japanese Americans to move to internment camp
Free the Mediterranean Sea from German Control
It lit the path for US & British forces to invade mainland
Allowed USSR to surround the Nazi army at Stalingrad

questions.question: Who were the major Allied Powers during World War II?

choices.answer: Germany, Italy, and Japan
Germany, Italy, Japan, and the Soviet Union
the United States, Britain, France, and Poland
the United States, Britain, France, and the Soviet Union

questions.question: Who were the Axis powers during World War II?

choices.answer: the United States, Great Britain, and France
the United States, Great Britain, France, & the Soviet Union
Germany, Italy, and Japan
Germany, Italy, Japan, and the Soviet Union

questions.question: Where did the largest sea invasion in world history take place (known as D-Day)?

choices.answer: Casablanca, Morocco
Stalingrad, USSR
Berlin, Germany
Normandy, France

questions.question: About how many Jews were murdered during the Holocaust?

choices.answer: six hundred
six thousand
six hundred thousand
six million

questions.question: Who was the President of the United States at the start of WWII?

choices.answer: Woodrow Wilson
Herbert Hoover
Franklin Delano Roosevelt
Harry S. Truman
